SENT.plain: Esophageal resection has still a high morbidity and mortality
Minimal-invasive procedures don't have such complications

We describe a case of a patient with a Barrett-Carcinoma who was operated on by laparoscopic blunt esophageal dissection with abdominal and mediastinal lymph node dissection (tumor stage: pT3pN1 (2/16) G2)
The postoperative course was without any complications
